intro: Cracca elongata, commonly known as the elongated cracca, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cracca elongata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges.
